website_summaries.verdict: Not ideal for large-scale cutting operations but reliable enough for home and farm use. Owners need to be diligent about cleaning and maintenance between uses.
pros: Lightweight and well-balanced for amateur users
cons: Reports of loose chains and poor oiling
Chain brake can stick in closed position
Not suited for large-scale tree trimming jobs

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! HOWEVER,
customer_reviews.text: THE ENGINE RUNS GREAT! HOWEVER, TWO THINGS WENT WRONG. EITHER THE BAR WAS BAD OR THE CHAIN WAS BAD. bEEN HEATING WITH WOOD FOR FORTY YEARS. WITHIN 20 MINUTES ON THE FIRST CUTTING THE CUT CURVED. I TOOK THE BAR IN AND YES IT WAS VERY VERY SLIGHTLY BENT AND APPEARED TO BE OVER HEATED ON ONE SIDE. BOUGHT A NEW BAR. STARTED CUTTING AGAIN AND ....CURVE. THE CHAIN WAS DULL ON ONE SIDE AND BADLY NEEDED SHARPENING. THE CHAIN SHARPENED EASILY. CUTS NICELY NOW. BUT THE CHAIN SEEMS TO BE A SOFTER METAL THAN I'VE EXPERIENCED.
customer_reviews.author: Jerome H. Squire

customer_reviews.title: I just hate it, sorry
customer_reviews.text: Bought in 2015 it is now year 2019, got little use out of it throws the chain and always has, spent more time trying to keep it running than actually using it. Everything I have bought from Husk company for the last few years has been bad even brand new. So, now I have to go and buy a Stihl I have no time to fight this piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: seabiscuit1958

customer_reviews.title: It starts every time.
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few months to write this review because even though the actual performance was absolutely great, I wanted to know how it would start after periods of inactivity. Now I can report that this chainsaw fires up immediately whenever called upon. The fact that I let the fuel run dry after use, probably is one key to dependable starting. . . regardless, this is a relatively expensive purchase for something that gets occasional use and there is nothing more aggravating than a small engine that will not start. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ed A.

customer_reviews.title: Just over 3yrs owned...
customer_reviews.text: It's a hell of a saw and definitely glad I made this buy. It's been put to work and has yet to leave me down. Only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that one of the plastic clips to remove the top cover broke about 6 months into owning it. The carb is more temperamental than my last Husqy. I find myself having to adjust it every time there's a 10degree temperature change. Overall, I'd rather have this saw than any other in it's class. A good friend of mine has a tree trimming business and is a hardcore Stihl guy. He secretly loves my Husqy too =D
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Came factory assembled with the chain on backwards
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for a day but it started right up and runs strong. The only reason it's not a five star rating is that it came factory assembled with the chain on backwards. Yes, backwards. Wtf. Took a minute of hacking on pulpy Douglas Fir to realize it was all dust and no chips. Thanks to the person in this forum who made the suggestion, I was wondering if it needed sharpened! Makes me wonder what else might be installed backwards in there, but so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a homeowner not a lumberjack. It is easy to start. Recommend the premixed fuel as it stay fresh longer and help starting between infrequent uses. Yes the fuel is more expensive but for infrequent uses it so easy and the start with one or two pulls. The anti vibration feature is great and work extremely well. I dont use chain saw often and this one looked a bit strange with the handle angle and the movement between the motor and handle. But it is easy to use, doesnt vibrate your hand to tingley numbness, and cuts wood like butter.
customer_reviews.author: AZS

customer_reviews.title: In order to convince the manufacturer about the problem you have to go through a tedious process of cleaning various parts
customer_reviews.text: The engine works well. However the chain keeps getting loose even after a short time of use. And the big problem is that the chain does not get enough oil. There is no way to adjust the oil flow (like other models have). In order to convince the manufacturer about the problem you have to go through a tedious process of cleaning various parts. But I have used this chainsaw only a few short 3 times.... How in the world am I supposed to spend an hour to clean it after every short 30 min use, just to prove that the oil flow is not good? If I would have to buy another chainsaw, I would not buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Valentin

customer_reviews.title: Spend more time in the shop than cutting
customer_reviews.text: Bought this saw on Amazon in 2017. Almost immediately it went to the shop to repair a bent bar that threw the chain off. Then back to the shop for crack in the fuel tank. Then it would not start. Had it checked numerous time at a repair shop and it worked for few days, then went back to not starting. If chain saws can be lemons, the one I have should be yellow. I will not buy Husqvarna again.
customer_reviews.author: mec

customer_reviews.title: No Start is not easy start, Warranty doesn't cover the engine?????????????
customer_reviews.text: Was tough to get it started upon arrival, as you might expect with a cold two stroke engine. did start well when warm, but now after 3 uses I can't start it at all, Always Used the $10/quart premixed fuel in it, cleaned air filter, checked the plug, now less than a year since I bought it and reading over the warranty, the engine is not covered??? don't know if want to throw good money after bad to try to have them tell me it is not covered under warranty or just write it off as another $475 mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was on time and very well packed. And as for the product, it runs super, has plenty of power for its 18" bar and I've gotten much more done than expected with it already. Haven't tried a longer bar but I'd expect it to easily handle a 20". Starts easily every time hot or cold. I'd gotten a second chain, but I'm still on the original. Goes all day on the pine I've been dropping with a little hand file touch up at the end of the day. No need to swap out chain in the field yet. A lot of oak coming up next so I'm expecting it will get used.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Maker

customer_reviews.title: This product is perfect we will never have anything bigger than this saw ...
customer_reviews.text: Extreme tree cutting capability. This product is perfect we will never have anything bigger than this saw can handle. We have 30 acreas and a whole lot of trees and this will always work and not just work. It will work better than good for everything we will need. a friend of mine cuts trees for a living and this is the same chainsaw that he has the only difference is that he put a 21" blade on his. That's another great thing is that you can change out the blades so if you need bigger you go bigger and never need to by a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Wynne

customer_reviews.title: Keeps going year after year
customer_reviews.text: I love my Husqvarna chainsaws! They just work reliably and well. I only needed a second one because on rare occasions, I get in a "bind" and having a second is so much easier than the old process of taking the motor off and putting on a new bar and chain to get the first bar and chain unbound. I almost never did that mind you... ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable product
customer_reviews.text: This chainsaw has never worked right over the past 3 years. It doesn't start half of the time. Oil and gas are filled to specifications so it is another issue. Customer service with Husqvarna is terrible, when you call they don't answer or put you on hold until you give up.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S.

customer_reviews.title: If you are thinking of buying this from Bailey's Power ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking of buying this from Bailey's Power Equipment. wait, I purchased one for 339.00 with only 7 left, a week later they are selling for 319.00 with 15 left, yes I feel ripped off. Saw gets 5 stars. --------------update------- the plot thickens, it's not Bailey's it's Amazon. Hello, Thank you for contacting Bailey's. I'm afraid Amazon chooses and changes the prices on a cycle. We have no say on their pricing decisions. I'm sorry I couldn't be more help. If you have any further questions, please don't hesitate to contact me. Best regards, Marketplace Representative Bailey's Inc
customer_reviews.author: Edmond Dantes

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic chainsaw. The pro who knocked down the trees ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic chainsaw. The pro who knocked down the trees for me looked it over and said that for a consumer saw it was more like a commercial one. It cut through a 100+ year old oak with ease and went through pine even easier. The chain is not your typical chain found on most for home use saws. One feature I love is the decompression valve. When you don't use a saw regularly starting it is a pain. Hit that button and follow the procedure and it fires up in a couple/three pulls. I have used various saws over the years and this is the best I have ever used outside of a Stihl and at a much lower cost.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna 450 Chainsaw 18in bar
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that I was disappointed in this saw at first. It was really underpowered until after I cut a chord of firewood with it. I literally felt the engine breaking in before finishing the load. It's a decent saw for the cost I think. The power is not bad and it starts easy. Being the owner of several Huskies, I never use the decompression button and found they start easier that way.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: works great. Sometimes hard to start
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of power, works great. Sometimes hard to start. Make sure safety handle is locked in the normal position before removing chain access cover. If not, it will be extremely difficult to reassemble. Instruction manual is written in pictures, and is hard to understand sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: A. Harty

customer_reviews.title: Required $108 of repairs that we were not reimbursed for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this chain saw for my husband for Christmas in 2016. Unfortunately, he did not use it until the following August when he learned that it didn't work. After speaking with Husqvarna, we were advised to take it in for repairs. The bill was a whopping $108 and we have no recourse to collect a refund. Also, we were advised by the dealer that this model was an old model and that is why we got such a great deal on it. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Susan M. Northey

customer_reviews.title: I hate to give anything 5 stars But....
customer_reviews.text: The saw was delivered quickly. I read the manual (a must). I filled it with gas and oil. I set the choke and compression release and gave two pulls and it fired. Turned off the choke as instructed and gave it another pull and it fired right up. I ran it a minute and let it drop to idle. It idled perfectly. It cut through several trees like butter. I have never had any chainsaw work so well. I will come back in a year and let you know. I usually cut 10 cords or more every year and I know saws. Hoping it will live up to it's early promise.
customer_reviews.author: John Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for around the farm
customer_reviews.text: This is one tough saw. Had to adjust the idle screw after a few months of use so it wouldn't stall, but that's just a matter of inserting a screw driver and turning a screw until the RPMs increase. Carb adjustments are accessible without removing the cover. I've used this around the farm for the last 2.5 years and really have no complaints. I also use it with a ripping blade in the Alaska Small Log Milling Attachment to mill the occasional beam for barn repair. Great all around maintenance saw.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw - Please understand Amazon policies.
customer_reviews.text: Another great piece of equipment from Husqvarna. So happy with it, that I want another. Unfortunately, Amazon discontinued it for the moment. I hope they bring it back. I'm very disappointed to see so many complaints about Amazon's return policy. Their return policy on power equipment is reasonable considering that returned items of this type will contain residual gasoline and oil. If it is defective you must follow up with the manufacturer. For your trouble, you receive a massive discount and free shipping to your door. This saved me about $95 compared to buying locally. For me it was well worth the risk.
customer_reviews.author: Fortunate Son

customer_reviews.title: Very powerfull Chainsaw!
customer_reviews.text: This 450 Husqvarna is real stong and seem to cut the downed trees like butter! I am still getting used to the starting quirks of this machine. I seem to flood the carb. too often, but as I get it started, the wood cutting is just "sweet", and it makes the work just shorter. The wieght of this chain saw is just right for me. I have cut almost have a cord worth of wood in about 2 hrs, and I consider the effeciency of this chain saw, tops. The oiling/lubrication for the chan/bar, is just right, using the Husqvarna oil. As an average homeowner, I can endorse and recommend this powerfull chain saw!
customer_reviews.author: Tony PI

customer_reviews.title: great saw - worth the extra bucks.
customer_reviews.text: great chain saw. Kicks the ass off my old "wild thing". This has plenty of power, great handling, and really slices through the logs. I almost bought another cheap brand saw thinking that I just don't use it enough.... but you find a better saw, you almost seek out opportunities to use it (maybe that will wear off soon?). Been three months, cut a few hundred logs, and so far, great product. Consumer reports rated this saw (and the similar Stihl version) near the top.
customer_reviews.author: Michael B

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power!!!
customer_reviews.text: Finally got to use this Husqvarna 450 with 18" bar. It is light weight compared to similar saws. My last Husqvarna saw lasted 15 years with regular use so i bought another. I am not disappointed!!! Starts easily if you know what you're doing.We cut 4 90' digger pines in one day. Pinched the chain once but was easily put back on and away I went. It was 20 degrees when we started and the saw worked flawlessly.Plenty of power. Good balance. Only thing that sucks is it is "CARB" compliant. ( California Air Resources Board) But that even doesn't seem to slow the power down. So overall is good mid range saw that can take on tough work.
customer_reviews.author: Chaplain Steve

customer_reviews.title: So far an excellent saw.
customer_reviews.text: This saw can cut. At first the chain seemed aggressive and tended to pull the saw toward the tree/branch/log.... but after using for a while it seems better. So far I have had no difficult starting the saw. It seem to be able to idle without continuously revving the engine all the time like older saws I had. The procedure for starting is on the saw itself. Symbols and numbered sequence for starting... I'd buy this saw again.
customer_reviews.author: B Truckman

customer_reviews.title: Great useful saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I was tired of spending an hour trying to start my Stihl. This one starts like a dream, and hopefully "Carb-compliant" means that the engine design is modern enough to handle the ethanol in the gas. I'm also grateful to Amazon for delivering it the middle of Sandy, when the local stores had no lights, never mind chainsaws. The above aside, it is light and reasonably if not excessively powerful. It is mainly plastic, which means that it will probably not take as much physical abuse as the (metal bodied) Stihl, but I don't plan to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas J. Rose

customer_reviews.title: Leaks oil everywhere after 3 hours use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this saw a little over two years and it now leaks oil everywhere. I took it to my local repair shop and they told me it was something wrong inside the saw they couldn't fix. Hopefully I can find a shop who can fix it but I am pretty bummed I spent this much money on a saw that is already broken.
customer_reviews.author: Damon G. Spark

customer_reviews.title: Beast
customer_reviews.text: Storm knocked a couple trees and a ton of branches down, I figured local stores would be sold out of saws. Ordered this and two days later was cutting through branches and logs like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: "Cuts like Butter"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because after going to Home Depot and waiting around for 6 people to try to find me the Echo I was looking for for over an hour. I opened my Amazon app and ordered this in less than 2 minutes. We got to use it the very next weekend because our front tree fell down. My husbands says, "It cuts like butter" in a very thick New York accent.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME CHAINSAW! Wouldn't hesitate to buy another one!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME CHAINSAW! After reading all the reviews of several chainsaw makes and models this one stood out with the reviews, price and power. Very happy with this purchase.! I bought this to take down 4 large trees that snapped in half after Hurricane Sandy then cut them up for removal. This saw is very easy to start, operate and maintain. Has good power! Glad that I went with this one and not another that had slightly less cc's .
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Mr Mom

customer_reviews.title: Love this saw!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a solidly performing work saw for the home owner or part time arborist. I love this thing. I have climbed it up trees and have used it to drop 60-80' pines in the area. It's a smooth-functioning saw and I'm so glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Solid and powerful saw
customer_reviews.text: It's a little difficult to start, but once it's on, it's ON! I purchased this saw to clear a small area of cedar and oak trees. Once I got going, I wound up clearing a much larger area with some good sized (14" diameter) trees. This saw tore through the cedar and even a few mesquite like they were butter. The chain holds up very well to the abuse of hard wood.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw - Does the job
customer_reviews.text: The saw is simple, easy start and cuts as well as the Stihl Farm Boss that I owned years ago. My only dissappointment came a couple of weeks after I purchased the saw. I discovered the saw was being sold at the local farm store for a lower price and came with a carry case, extra chain and file. Does not hurt the performance of the saw but feel as if I got shorted on the deal. I would still recommend the saw in a heart beat but check around for the best buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rooster

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: Had this chainsaw now for a few years. Nice unit. My yard guy is a Stihl man, but prefers to use the Husqvarna chainsaw over his Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: Walter L.

customer_reviews.title: You Need This
customer_reviews.text: Best chainsaw I've ever owned. After I bought this I also bought Husqvarna's mower and power head. What a great company with quality tools that work all the time, everytime. Good job guys. You've made my yard work a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S

customer_reviews.title: The best saw I've owned
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace my 22 year old Husky 45 Special. I never expected so much advancement in construction and operation. My Husky 45 may be a lonely backup to this saw as it seems far advanced. It is miserly on gas and chain oil. It starts easily, cuts quickly and is easier to handle than my old 45.The Husky chains have also improved dramatically. In hindsight, I would have purchased the 460 Rancher for greater durability and even greater air filtration technology.
customer_reviews.author: do_2

customer_reviews.title: Had an initial issue with it but it is fine now
customer_reviews.text: After the first pull the cord ended up in my hand, but it is working fine now
customer_reviews.author: Don M Lillibridge

customer_reviews.title: The saw is easy to crank and has at least ample power
customer_reviews.text: Got the chainsaw when the price dipped a little sweetening the deal. The saw is easy to crank and has at least ample power.
customer_reviews.author: L. L.

customer_reviews.title: Junk...Buy a Stihl !
customer_reviews.text: Hard starting,never ran right.Had defective manifold that made it run lean and eventually burned up.Just over warranty and husqvarna won't do anything.For the same price ,u can get a Stihl and a 4 year warranty instead of the husqvarnas 2.
customer_reviews.author: gator

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, that's what I'm talking about.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts fast, not too heavy, starts pretty good. Warm starting could be easier. Also I have to rant about the all in one choke, on off switch. Just give me separate choke and on off switches like everyone else has for 50 years. Quit trying to be cute. Otherwise you would have gotten 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie40

customer_reviews.title: Great saw
customer_reviews.text: If you need a saw to do it all, this is the one. I have cut multiple ceder, fir, and cherry with it so far. The 50cc engine is perfect size for plenty of power but is not too much to scare you. I have the 18" bar installed. This is a great size for collecting firewood in the forest, to clearing trees/limbs on your property. It starts easy and has been simple to maintain for all my uses. Great tool and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: mille35

customer_reviews.title: Makes me feel invicible!
customer_reviews.text: I've cut down 4 trees so far. Love the "timber" part of the process. It could be addictive cutting and watching the tree fall to the ground. The original chain that came with it seemed like garbage. After 2 trees...it wasn't dull. Bought a new chain and installed it up easily.........so much better now. Started right up on the first try. Easy start-up instructions. Powerful enough. Weight can be a bit heavy for the elderly. I'm Husqvarna glad!
customer_reviews.author: Ektyper

customer_reviews.title: Great saw for the home owner
customer_reviews.text: I just finished cutting my 6th 40 foot evergreen. The trunk of two of them were 18" diameter. It went through them like butter. Starting the saw cold and hot was very easy, just follow the cartoon printed on the saw. I'm guessing the people with starting problems didn't follow the correct sequence. My only complaint is the ridiculous manual. The diagrams are all on the first few pages and you have to keep flipping pages. If you go to Husqvarna's web site you can find an electronic manual that has the diagrams on the same page as the text. Great saw, Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Top knotch
customer_reviews.text: Used a Stihl saw for years, upgraded after tornado downed 17 trees in my property. Good excuse to get a new saw. Brother in Law used a Husky for years, building log homes. Easy to start, smooth, no chain drift, cuts like butter - even through hard maple. Very Happy.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: probably the best all purpose chainsaw I have ever owned. I have owned and used virtually every brand over the last 50 years. great saw for home owner.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: love this saw
customer_reviews.text: love this saw. easy starting good power have had no problems with it I heat with wood so it gets worked a lot and just doesn't quit.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Clark

customer_reviews.title: but nice to have a newer model
customer_reviews.text: Arrived when promised, and has worked very well. Very similar to my older (13 year old Jonsred) saw which has served me well, but nice to have a newer model. Lighter and plenty powerful for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: Alden

customer_reviews.title: Handles nicely
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time last weekend and it handled well. Fairly light and easy. The manual had so much CYA legalistic disclaimers that it was hard to sort out the important stuff. Luckily it's reasonably simple to use with starting instructions on the unit itself. Some shipping confusion made for a long wait.
customer_reviews.author: Slr

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 Bluemax chainsaws before this they were pure junk. This is 10 times the product but also twice the cost. The old saying you get what you pay for is true, spend the extra money Husqvarna is no hassles verses the alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: With a bad storm coming in, I wanted to buy this at a local store to replace a (dead) Poulan that I was never satisfied with. Locally the saw only came with a 40cc engine and was the same price. On the day of the storm I got stranded a mile from my house between 2 downed trees and was hating myself. However, I was eventually rescued and now, after using this saw on a number of occasions, I'm very happy. It starts, stops, and idles, when it's supposed to and the engine is powerful enough to make easy work of even hefty trees.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff V.

customer_reviews.title: The price of the unit was fantastic plus the reviews here and other sites inspired confidence ...
customer_reviews.text: The price of the unit was fantastic plus the reviews here and other sites inspired confidence to purchase. The saw is plenty powerful and cuts with ease. The only drawback is an 18 inch bar. I haven't experienced that as a limitation yet though. Starts with ease runs great.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine. Started on the first pull
customer_reviews.text: Great machine. Started on the first pull. Works just as I would expect fro Husqvarna. As a novice to "logging", I had no problem using it. The only thing I do not like is the two cycle engine that requires mixed fuel. But there is no option for these small, high revving engines. I highly recomend this product.
customer_reviews.author: B2

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saw! Starts easily
customer_reviews.text: Awesome saw! Starts easily, cuts through logs and trees like a hot knife through butter. It doesn't bog down or struggle through anything. We use it for fire wood so it gets a lot of use!
customer_reviews.author: Brenda M

customer_reviews.title: Nice machine. Well worth the investment to step up ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this on an emergency basis when two trees fell in yard and old Poulan stopped working. Handled the clean up quickly, powerfully, and with much less vibration than the old Poulan. Nice machine. Well worth the investment to step up from typical consumer/home owner brands to pro level. Looking forward to the legendary dependability.
customer_reviews.author: AMERICAN DAD

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic chain saw. A lot more than ever expected. Absolutely no issues at all. I highly recommend this chain saw.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband and he simply loves it. Runs great and has been put to the use. Very great machine. Would buy again and would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: tonya

customer_reviews.title: Good chainsaw bad brake design!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased off Amazon. Used it for two days and it jammed. The brake would lever was locked so could not use the saw. Took it to a local repair saw who suggested sending it back since he has seen such issues and they are tough to fix. Called Husq customer support who suggested I take it to a local service center. They say its going to cost me. I purchases this four months ago. Recommend use it immediately so it can be repaired under warranty.
customer_reviews.author: PMavin

customer_reviews.title: Kicked sanys butt
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few days before hurricane sandy thinking my 2 50foot trees would fall..good thing I bought this because they did easy to assemble just follow the directions mix the fuel properly and cut two 50foot trees down to manageable size logs.....blade sharpener files are necessary or extra blades but this machine I will probably pass to my kids
customer_reviews.author: HD TOW TRUCK OPERATOR

customer_reviews.title: Great saw and fully assembled right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Great saw and fully assembled right out of the box. After fueling and bar oil were added it cranked on the second pull and has already been used to cut up two oak trees with no problem. This is a lightweight saw that is easy to handle. Make sure to adjust your chain tension before starting or cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cranked up easily
customer_reviews.text: We cranked it up and it works well. We had this brand at the fire department and they always worked when we needed them so when I needed one at home this was it.
customer_reviews.author: Donald B Woodward Jr

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: The one-bolt system on this saw simply won't hold the chain to a proper tightness. Ruined two chains.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great chainsaw
customer_reviews.text: I have owned at least 5 chain saws over thew years, mostly the Homelites. On many occasions I have used other chain saws, including Craftsman and Stilh. Without hesitation, the Husqvarna 450 is the best saw I have used due to 1) It starts easily and keeps running with no problems 2) It is very powerful in relation to its small weight and size. Amazing power in a small package 3) The chain brake system works great and provides added safety.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Gussler

customer_reviews.title: I'm in love with this saw
customer_reviews.text: I had to clear a large Oak tree across the dam in order to get out of the woods to go to an appointment. This saw did the job efficiently and quickly. It cut through that tough Oak wood without pausing. I had never owned a Husqvarna; but if I ever need another saw it will be a Husqvarna.
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect chainsaw runs great
customer_reviews.text: This saw is light starts on the first and second Pull every time plenty of power this is a great saw
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: This chain saw rocks!
customer_reviews.text: Starts easily, cuts through wood like butter, chain oiler works flawlessly, balance & weight of the saw "feels just right" ... who can ask for more? Why I put up with my old Craftsman for so long, who knows? Got this Husqvarna 450 from Amazon for a great price with fast shipping. Go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Mc

customer_reviews.title: Great Chainsaw...I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this chainsaw. Easy start with no vibration. Rips through oak like butter.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Keck

customer_reviews.title: Best saw I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is amazing! Buy it. You will love it. Best chainsaw I've ever owned. Gets about one chord of wood per tank of gas too.
customer_reviews.author: source.5

customer_reviews.title: Was a little worried buying this saw looking at the reviews on it.
customer_reviews.text: I am delightfully surprised with this saw which I bought for light yard work at my place of residence. Although I bought this for light work around my yard, I will be using this saw for blocking up trees for firewood. This saw is the easiest starting saw I have ever owned and I have owned a half dozen or so. Don't let the negative reviews stop you from purchasing this saw.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent All Around Saw
customer_reviews.text: Got this saw to both use around our ranch and also cut firewood. It does it all--cuts through everything from big timber to fence posts with ease, small enough to limb easily and starts very quickly every time. Be sure to tighten the nut that secures the drive housing...it'll rattle loose if you're not careful. I'd highly recommend this saw to anyone needing something a touch bigger than a household saw and smaller than a commercial timber axe.
customer_reviews.author: IdahoSheepGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the 3rd sears craftsman chainsaw that have failed in three years. I was somewhat worried about reviews about hard starting but decided they probably knew nothing about starting chainsaws. I was right. Started after 5 pulls. Worked great. Light. Sturdy although looks like a toy. Definitely would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Michael P. Mcintire

customer_reviews.title: Husky.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Chainsaw. 1-3 pulls starts Every time. Recommend tightening tension regularly. Should last Me a long time.
customer_reviews.author: woopya

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna 450 18-inch gas powered chain saw
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband and it is a really good saw. He's had a Husky for 19 years and it's still cutting. I just thought it was time for a new one. My husband loves it and says it cuts like cutting through butter. A good investment that lasts a long time. I'd highly recommend it compared to other saws on the market.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: It cuts well
customer_reviews.text: Dissapointed it was an E series, but works pretty good. Starting is tricky.
customer_reviews.author: kyle purvis

customer_reviews.title: This saw is an ANIMAL!
customer_reviews.text: Starts very easily when following directions: two pulls on choke; two pulls off choke. Lots of power. Cuts through everything fast. No leaking oil (others have mentioned this). I have no complaints about this saw. It replaces an ancient Mac 3516 - no comparison! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw
customer_reviews.text: I've been using old, used, beat up saws all my life, so I thought I'd treat myself to a new one this year. Well, I just finished cutting 7 cord of fire wood with it. This saw is great, right out of the box. I had no problems starting it. I had to tighten the blade twice and file the blade once though the entire 7 cord. I'm Very impressed and happy with my purchase. This Husqvarna is the only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Heath

customer_reviews.title: Excellent saw! Lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Excellent saw! Lightweight, well made. Some reviewers have complained about starting. I had no trouble with starting whatsoever. Follow the starting instructions to the letter, especially the warm starting instructions.
customer_reviews.author: NWCT Iota

customer_reviews.title: He is very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for his birthday to replace the one he wore out. He is very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Well, my Swedish husband was tickled to receive this ...
customer_reviews.text: Well, my Swedish husband was tickled to receive this as a birthday gift and can't wait to go trim down those dead tree branches!
customer_reviews.author: thershegoesagn

customer_reviews.title: came broken!
customer_reviews.text: It's a great chainsaw, no doubt about it. I wish I could have used it the day I received it. It came out of the box broken. I called to return it and get a new one. No can do said Amazon. You have to keep it and we will return your money, they said. $48 dollars later on a new part the thing is a beast! I got a credit back for the chainsaw and it costs me $48 bucks for the new part. Pray yours comes broken!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chain saw
customer_reviews.text: Item was delivered earlier than anticipated; which is a good thing! The blade is more substantial than lower priced models from other companies. This makes cutting easy and quick. Wish I'd bought it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't work!!
customer_reviews.text: Brand new out of the box and doesn't work. Not returnable since gas was put in it. So what do I do with it? Don't ever buy gas fueled products online!! What a waste of $400+!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: J C.

customer_reviews.title: great saw!
customer_reviews.text: despite the plastic part that spools up the pull cord broke a piece off (still works) I would highly recomment this saw. It is plenty powerful to cut large trees. Just keep the chain sharp and out of the dirty and turn the bar oiler screw up.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Stilkenboom

customer_reviews.title: Great saw!
customer_reviews.text: The saw starts easily and cuts great. I don't know what else I could want/need in a saw. It's light enough that you don't get sore using it. It works so good that I'm thinking about getting a Granberg mill attachment and trying it out as a home sawmill.
customer_reviews.author: AJR

customer_reviews.title: Trust Husqvarna
customer_reviews.text: Great saw for the average homeowner! Works great for tree trimming as well as dropping and cutting up trees and bushes. Easy to start, runs great, and with the Husqvarna saw chain it'll eat through large timber and ask for more!
customer_reviews.author: Frankenstein

customer_reviews.title: Read the start instructions and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a beast with this thing. Really earning my man-card. Read the start instructions and you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: sshields

customer_reviews.title: Mix performance
customer_reviews.text: Hard to start, once it gets going it runs great. Chain didn't stay sharp long, so didn't get more than 4 hours cutting out of it. Will keep it, but changing out chain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: This saw was everything I thought it would be and more.The smooth start and anti vibration are a must have, which made this saw a pleasure to use. I would recommend this item to anyone that needs the toughness and power to do the job around the home or farm.
customer_reviews.author: I. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Had difficulty starting in the end took it to local ...
customer_reviews.text: Had difficulty starting in the end took it to local dealer to be informed that the machines are factory started and left with oil in the carburetor therefore they are hard to start. Perhaps I will purchase such items locally in the future. Alternatively Husqvarna should inform customers of this fact .....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my husband, which he received early. He is thrilled with the saw, and the features it includes. The only thing I was unhappy with was that it was not put in another box, so when the man delivered it, he knew exactly what it was.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to start which is a big plus
customer_reviews.text: Easy to start which is a big plus. I have a little Eager Beaver saw that's 20 years old, hoping this one lasts just as long!!
customer_reviews.author: Mik Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great saw.
customer_reviews.text: Great saw and runs perfect. The case is a little cheap but works
customer_reviews.author: Imjaybird

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The best of the best. Even I can handle it. So many extras on it too.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Lentzl

customer_reviews.title: Husky 450 Chain Saw
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for eight months and have cut seven or eight cord of oak and fell a half dozen big pine. The Pros... Starts just fine,smooth and lots of power for my needs cuts great. The neg.... The handle is to small to fit my 11EE work boot in for starting, it has not been a problem but I would like to be able to adjust the bar oilier. I been cutting my firewood for over 30 years and this is my third Husky, over all a great saw for the money if your new to chainsaws be careful this is not a toy.
customer_reviews.author: bigcat

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: My first chainsaw. I wanted to get one I could use for most everything I might encounter: helping neighbors with fallen storm trees, trail clearing and occasional firewood. Had some problems at first getting it started but I think it's because I'm used to old chainsaws. This thing starts on 2 or 3 pulls most every time. I pull the choke out, pull once or twice then push it in and pull and start.
customer_reviews.author: mahonri

customer_reviews.title: I really like the way it handled
customer_reviews.text: I really like the way it handled! It's a good saw for the money. It runs really smooth and it is a dependable saw. Husqvarna is a great name brand in the chainsaw industry. I have gotten away with cheaper brands, but you get what you pay for. Don't settle for less and please be safe!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: bad carburetor
customer_reviews.text: Used it just a few hours and had to replace carburetor. Follow up post: Carburetor did not fix the problem. Now it is a bad cylinder. Definitely would not consider buying this chainsaw again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Husqvarna 450 18"
customer_reviews.text: Had always purchased Stihl. This was my first Husqvarna. This saw is fantastic. It easily takes down large trees. The starting system makes it very easy to start this saw.
customer_reviews.author: SMG

customer_reviews.title: Working well so far
customer_reviews.text: Saw working well so far under hard use on a land clearing job. Long term reliability and effectiveness still under review.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie J. Stratton

customer_reviews.title: This Husky rocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love, love, love this saw...was debating for months between this one and an 18" comparable Stihl, that was about $100 more...when my buddy's Stihl broke down last month and I saw how much the replacement Stihl parts were (Stihl charges about 3X more for their parts than the others because you have to buy their parts), decided to go with the Husky...could not be more pleased with the power, startup, the weight, handling, everything about this saw is great...do yourself a favor and save the money with this one instead of the overpriced Stihl.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: cuts & rus great, easy
customer_reviews.text: Fires first pull or three every time. Cuts great, not too heavy/ bulky. Leaks bar oil while in storage, but supposedly they all do. Holds chain tension well, easy to adjust. Air filter easy to access (clean). Would buy again and recommend to others. We heat exclusively with wood and it does pretty good cutting all day. When it gets hot it doesn't seem to run as well... I need to look into it. Pulled it out after winter storage (3/2017) and it fired up first pull!!
customer_reviews.author: Aden B

product_meta.title: Husqvarna 450 18-Inch 50.2cc X-Torq 2-Cycle Gas Powered Chain Saw With Smart Start
product_meta.description:
Exceptional Products For Exceptional Yards. Great yards demand equipment that's as dedicated and hardworking as you. Fortunately, the Husqvarna range of lawn and garden equipment offers everything from lawnmowers and ride-on mowers to trimmers and chainsaws to let you master your great outdoors. You and Husqvarna - together we will make your yard the envy of the neighborhood. The Husqvarna 450 is a powerful all-round saw for people who value professional qualities in a saw. The X-Torq engine means lower fuel consumption and reduced emission levels. Auto return stop switch and visible fuel level makes the saw easier to handle. Equipped with Smart Start and fuel pump to every time ensure easy starts. 2 Year Parts & Labor Warranty. Every unit is tested at the manufacturer.

AMAZON.COM


Designed to fit the needs of homeowners and do-it-yourselfers, the 18-inch, 3.2 HP Husqvarna 450 is ideal for landowners and others who cut less regularly. Equipped with Smart Start and fuel pump, it's easy to start and operate. It also offers an ergonomic design plus built-in Husqvarna features like air injection technology and a powerful X-Torq engine with low emissions.

Centrifugal air cleaning system results in 
reduced air filter cleanings and improved 
engine life (see larger image). 

Combined start/stop switch, Smart Start 
and fuel pump make the saw very easy 
to start (see larger image). The Husqvarna 450 chain saw (see larger image). POWERFUL 1.8HP X-TORQ ENGINE KEEPS EMISSIONS LOW
The 450 delivers 3.2 horsepower, making it well-suited for medium-duty jobs, such as pruning and domestic cutting. The engine features Husqvarna's special X-Torq technology, which reduces emission levels by up to 60 percent and fuel consumption by up to 30 percent, so you'll be able to harness the power of a gas-powered chainsaw without having to worry about heavy pollutant output.

DURABLE ENGINE BUILT FOR LONG LIFE
The 450's engine has been built to withstand years of use. It uses a three-piece crankshaft, which has been forged and compressed for superior durability. Also, the chainsaw's centrifugal air cleaning system helps preserve engine life by removing harmful debris before it reaches the filter.

EASY, EFFORTLESS STARTUP
With the 450, you won't have to waste precious minutes trying to start the engine. The chainsaw uses a combined choke/stop control, which allows for easy engine starting and reduces the risk of flooding. Husqvarna's Smart Start offers an engine and starter that starts quickly with minimum effort--with resistance in the starter cord reduced by up to 40 percent. It also has a specially optimized fuel pump, which keeps the fuel lines clear and helps facilitate startup.

Visible fuel level (see larger image). 

Quick-release air filter (see larger image). ERGONOMIC DESIGN REDUCES USER FATIGUE
The 450 has a lightweight frame that minimizes strain on your body, even after extended use. Husqvarna's LowVib anti-vibration dampeners effectively absorb vibration, sparing your arms and hands from added fatigue and allowing you to work longer and more comfortably. And it features a smartly designed rear handle with soft inlay, ergonomic trigger, and asymmetrical handle.

PREMIUM FEATURES FOR EASY OPERATION
The 450 is designed both for fast action when cutting and when you need to modify the chain saw while out in the field. It includes a snap-lock cylinder cover that saves you time when changing the spark plugs or cleaning the unit, quick and easy tool-less chain tensioning and assembling of the bar, and a quick-release air filter for quick replacement. And the transparent fuel indicator makes it easy to check fuel level.

Other features include an inertia activated chain brake that helps reduce the likelihood of injury due to kickback, distinct marks for better felling precision, and an air purge function that removes air from the carburetor and fuel system for easier starting. It's backed by a 2-year limited warranty.

KEY SPECIFICATIONS
 * Power output: 3.2 HP 
 * Cylinder displacement: 50.2 cc 
 * Maximum power speed: 9600 RPM 
 * Fuel tank volume: 0.95 pint (15.2 fluid ounces) 
 * Oil pump type: Fixed flow 
 * Chain speed at max power: 56.89 fts 
 * Weight: 11.33 pounds 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Husqvarna 450 chainsaw and manual

HUSQVARNA: EXCEPTIONAL PRODUCTS FOR EXCEPTIONAL YARDS
Great yards demand equipment that is as dedicated and hardworking as you are. Fortunately, Husqvarna's range of garden equipment offers everything from lawnmowers and snow blowers to trimmers and chainsaws that let you master your slice of the great outdoors. With Husqvarna, it's easy to make your yard the envy of the neighborhood. Founded in Sweden in 1689, Husqvarna is one of the world's oldest companies.



FROM THE MANUFACTURER
New powerful all-round saw for people who value professional qualities in a saw. The X-Torq engine means lower fuel consumption and reduced emission levels. Auto return stop switch and visible fuel level makes the saw easier to handle. Equipped with Smart Start and fuel pump to every time ensure easy starts.

See more
feature_bullets: Powerful 18-inch gas-powered chain saw ideal for landowners and others who cut less regularly
3.2 HP X-Torq engine reduces harmful exhaust emissions and increase fuel efficiency
LowVib vibration dampening; minimal effort via Smart Start feature and combined choke/stop control
Centrifugal air cleaning system; inertia activated chain brake; snap-lock cylinder cover
Purchase this Husqvarna handheld item along with 3-32 ounce cans of Husqvarna pre-mix fuel, register your product online, and your consumer warranty will be extended from 2 years to 4 years
